comments.body:
Can you fix the docs for targets? It's documented as a list of dictionaries, but it needs to just be a list for this to work
```
            targets:
                - "subnet-17bbda4c"
                - "172.31.29.72"
                - [
                    "sg-29d13055",
                    "sg-5e27db2f"
                ]
```
(note that this doesn't work with multiple security groups provided, but that's a preexisting bug and would need has_targets() to be fixed a little).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +350,354 @@    if targets:
        targets = [(item, prefix_to_attr(item)) for item in targets]
        file_systems_info = [item for item in file_systems_info if has_targets(item['mount_targets'], targets)]

    module.exit_json(changed=False, ansible_facts={'efs': file_systems_info})

comments.body:
This change should probably be added to efs.py as well

Not sure `version_added` works here does it? Probably needs to be `returned: when botocore is newer than x`.

- The relevant descriptions are already present in efs.py
- You're right, ```version_added``` wasn't checked by the tests (2.7 instead of 2.8 didn't trigger the failure) and it doesn't make any sense here - Updated

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +137,141 @@    type: str
    sample: "generalPurpose"
throughput_mode:
    description: mode of throughput for the file system
    returned: when botocore >= 1.10.57
